Function Documentation

eolInt eol_bool_from_string ( char *  truth  ) 

converts a string represention of true/false to the value accepts "true", "TRUE" and "True" / "false", "FALSE" and "False"

Parameters:
truth the string to check for "true" or "false"
Returns:
eolTrue if "true" or eolFalse if "false",-1 if nothing

Parameters:

p2 another point for the distance check
size the value to check against
Returns:
eolTrue if the distance between P1 and P2 is less than size, false otherwise

Definition at line 48 of file eol_types.c.

eolBool eol_equals ( eolDouble  a,
eolDouble  b 
)

Determines if the two floats are effectively equal within the thresholds of floating point accuracry.

Parameters:
a double to compare
b other double to compare
Returns:
eolTrue is they are withing +/- of EOL_EPSILON of each other. eolFalse otherwise.

void eol_trail_free ( eolTrail *  trail  ) 

frees allocated trail data. resets the trail struct to zero does not free the trail structure iself, just the data allocated within it.

Parameters:
trail a pointer to a trail struct. if NULL, it does nothing

Definition at line 235 of file eol_types.c.

eolBool eol_trail_get_nth ( eolTrail *  trail,
eolUint  n,
eolOrientation *  ori 
)

retrieves the orientation n spots behind the head.

Parameters:
trail the trail to search through
n how many positions behind head to retrieve. if n is beyond maxLen, it will fail
ori output paramater. Must provide a valid orientation pointer or function does nothing
Returns:
eolTrue if it found the nth orientation or eolFalse on error.
